conclusion: Analyze electric field strength at intersection of diagonals of square ABCD with charges at vertices.
Identify charges and positions: +q at A and B, -q at C and D, side length L.
Diagonals of square intersect at center, center is at L/2 from each vertex.
Electric field at center due to point charge q is E = kq/r^2.
Distance from center to each vertex is L/2.
Substitute values into electric field formula: E = 4kq/L^2.
Electric field at intersection is average of fields at two vertices.
Symmetrically placed charges mean electric field strength is same for both diagonals.
Electric field strength at intersection is E = 4kq/L^2.
Final answer: Electric field strength at intersection of diagonals is 4kq/L^2.
Problem involves calculating electric field strength at intersection of diagonals with point charges at vertices.
Electric field strength at center calculated using formula for electric field due to point charge.
Diagonals intersect at center, electric field strength at intersection is average of fields at vertices.
Symmetry of charges and properties of square used to determine electric field strength at intersection.
